bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The United States Circuit Court for the District of Washington

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT CIRCUIT COURT FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Petition of James P. Lavin, Immigrant Inspector, and Sister M. Angelique, Sister Superior of the House of Good Shepherd, for a Writ of Certiorari}
James P. Lavin, Immigrant Inspector, and Sister M. Angelique, Appellants -vs- Yvonne LeFevre, Georgette Normand and Marie Le Fevre, Respondents.}

This matter coming up upon the application of the United States Attorney for an order forfeiting the cash bail in the sum of $1000 deposited in the registry of this court on the 6th. day of March, 1903 by the respondents Yvonne LeFevre and Marie LeFevre in pursuance of the order of this court entered herein on the said 6th. day of March, 1903. requiring said respondents to give bail pending the appeal of the above entitled cause in the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, for their appearance in the above entitled court to answer the judgment of the Said United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit and of this court, and it appearing to the court that judgment of this court on the mandate of said United States Court of Appeals was entered herein on the 7th. day of January, 1904 reversing the order and judgment made in this cause on the 5th. day of March, 1903 and remanding the said respondents Yvonne LeFevre and Marie LeFevre to the custody of James P. Lavin, Immigrant Inspector; and it further appearing to the court that neither of said respondents Yvonne LeFevre or Marie LeFevre have so appeared to answer said judgment of this court
entered herein on the said 7th. day of January 1904, and more than a reasonable time having elapsed since the entry of said judgment, and said respondents Yvonne LeFevre and Marie LeFevre not so appearing to answer same, and the court being fully advised in the premises, and all things here understood;-

Now therefore, it is ordered that the said sum of $1000., now on deposit in the registry of this court as cash bail for the appearance of said respondents Yvonne LeFevre and Marie LeFevre, be, and the same hereby is, forfeited to the United States; and the clerk of this court is hereby directed to cover the said sum of $1000. into the treasury of the United States.
Done in open court this 22nd day of July, 1904.
Due and full sevice of within acknowledge this day of, 189 Attorney for
IN THE CircuitDistrict COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, Northern Division.
THE UNITED STATES VS. Yvonne LeFevre and Marie Le Fevre
FILED IN THE U.S. Circuit Court, DIST. OF WASHINGTON, JULY 22 1904 A.REVES AYRES, Clerk R. M. Hopkins Deputy
Jesse A. Frye Wilson R. Gay, UNITED STATES ATTORNEY, SEATTLE, WASHINGTON
